channel.title: Oh Kirby!
channel.description:
Oh Kirby.. What has happened to you? From what use to be a great game fighting the evil penguin while gathering stars. Defeating the tree who blew apples and bombs. What have you become?
Kirby 64 who remembers that game?
Look how crappy the game has become:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DbkFor4LBcs

I remember playing Kirby’s Adventure on the NES, good times.

item.title: Oh Kirby!
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

kirby 64 was garbage… now kirby dreamworld on the gameboy that was the shit.

Wait are you talking about the original gameboy?

en.wikipedia.org

Kirby's Dream Land

Kirby's Dream Land[a] is a video game developed by HAL Laboratory and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy. Released in 1992, it is both the first video game in the Kirby series and the debut of Kirby himself. As the inaugural Kirby title it created many conventions that would appear in later games in the series. However, Kirby's iconic "copy" ability would not appear until Kirby's Adventure, released less than one year later. Kirby's Dream Land was designed by Masahiro Sakurai, who intended it...

I still have that game, yes it was really good.

Read full topic

item.title: Oh Kirby!
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Lin:

Since when have games that have been around before 2003 gotten any better after 2003, with the exception of Zelda Twilight Princess? You should have seen this coming.

Not entirely true. If your talking about story-based games. Then yes. But if your talking about online 1st person shooters, then no.

But ya, I haven’t remembered the last time a played good story based game in awhile.

Read full topic
